testcase.name: JSONPlaceholder API - CRUD Operations Demo › Create, Read, Update, Delete operations on existing post
JSONPlaceholder API - POST Create Post › TC 3.1: Create Post - Status 201, echo check, id=101
JSONPlaceholder API - POST Create Post › TC 3.2: Empty Payload - Test API strictness
JSONPlaceholder API - POST Create Post › TC 3.3: Field Echo Check - Extra field (admin: true) echoed back
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Posts › TC 1.1: Get All Posts - Status 200, JSON content-type, response time < 800ms
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Posts › TC 1.2: Sort Order - Verify ascending ID order
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Posts › TC 1.3: Data Types - Zod schema validates id, userId are numbers; title, body are strings
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Posts › TC 1.4: Filter Check - GET /posts?userId=1 returns 10 items with userId=1
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Posts › TC 2.1: Get Post 99 - Verify userId=10, id=99, non-empty title/body
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Posts › TC 2.2: Negative - Not Found - GET /posts/150 returns 404 with empty object
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Posts › TC 2.3: Negative - Invalid ID - GET /posts/abc returns 404 or 400
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › POST Create - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.1: Boundary - Handle extremely long title and body
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › POST Create - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.2: Negative - Handle invalid userIds
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › POST Create - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.3: Negative - Handle post with empty strings
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › POST Create - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.4: Security - Handle special characters and security payloads
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › PUT Update - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.5: Negative - Handle updating with invalid post IDs
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › PUT Update - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.6: Boundary - Handle partial update with empty payload
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › DELETE - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.7: Negative - Handle deleting non-existent and already deleted posts
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › GET - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.8: Negative - Handle getting posts with invalid IDs
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › GET - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.9: Negative - Handle getting posts with invalid query parameter
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › Content-Type and Headers - Negative Scenarios › TC 6.10: Negative - Handle POST with missing or wrong Content-Type
JSONPlaceholder API - Negative Tests › Boundary Value Testing › TC 6.11: Boundary - Handle boundary values for userId and special whitespace
JSONPlaceholder API - PUT Partial Update › should update only provided fields (title) using PUT
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Users and Data Consistency › TC 4.1: Get All Users - Status 200, exactly 10 users
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Users and Data Consistency › TC 4.2: Deep Data User 5 - Verify nested Address, Geo, Company structure
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Users and Data Consistency › TC 4.3: Data Range - Verify geo.lat (-90 to 90), geo.lng (-180 to 180)
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Users and Data Consistency › TC 5.1: Cross-Check User 5 - Compare /users/5 with /users list
JSONPlaceholder API - GET Users and Data Consistency › TC 5.2: Relational Check - Verify User 5's posts exist and belong to User 5
GET /api/users - Get All Users › should return 200 status with valid response time
